Events.text: After divorcing his wife Minervina, Constantine marries Fausta, daughter of the retired Roman Emperor Maximian.
Events.html: After divorcing his wife Minervina, Constantine marries Fausta, daughter of the retired Roman Emperor Maximian.

Events.text: Battle of the Trench: Muhammad undergoes a 14-day siege at Medina (Saudi Arabia) by Meccan forces under Abu Sufyan.
Events.html: Battle of the Trench: Muhammad undergoes a 14-day siege at Medina (Saudi Arabia) by Meccan forces under Abu Sufyan.

Events.text: Bernard of Clairvaux preaches his famous sermon in a field at Vézelay, urging the necessity of a Second Crusade. Louis VII is present, and joins the Crusade.
Events.html: Bernard of Clairvaux preaches his famous sermon in a field at Vézelay, urging the necessity of a Second Crusade. Louis VII is present, and joins the Crusade.

Events.text: Queen Isabella of Castile issues the Alhambra Decree, ordering her 150,000 Jewish and Muslim subjects to convert to Christianity or face expulsion.
Events.html: Queen Isabella of Castile issues the Alhambra Decree, ordering her 150,000 Jewish and Muslim subjects to convert to Christianity or face expulsion.

Events.text: The city of San Cristóbal, Táchira is founded.
Events.html: The city of San Cristóbal, Táchira is founded.

Events.text: A sermon on "The Nature of the Kingdom of Christ" by Benjamin Hoadly, the Bishop of Bangor, provokes the Bangorian Controversy.
Events.html: A sermon on "The Nature of the Kingdom of Christ" by Benjamin Hoadly, the Bishop of Bangor, provokes the Bangorian Controversy.

Events.text: American Revolutionary War: The Kingdom of Great Britain orders the port of Boston, Massachusetts closed pursuant to the Boston Port Act.
Events.html: American Revolutionary War: The Kingdom of Great Britain orders the port of Boston, Massachusetts closed pursuant to the Boston Port Act.

Events.text: The massacre of the population of the Greek island of Chios by soldiers of the Ottoman Empire following an attempted rebellion, depicted by the French artist Eugène Delacroix.
Events.html: The massacre of the population of the Greek island of Chios by soldiers of the Ottoman Empire following an attempted rebellion, depicted by the French artist Eugène Delacroix.

Events.text: Commodore Matthew Perry signs the Convention of Kanagawa with the Tokugawa Shogunate, opening the ports of Shimoda and Hakodate to American trade.
Events.html: Commodore Matthew Perry signs the Convention of Kanagawa with the Tokugawa Shogunate, opening the ports of Shimoda and Hakodate to American trade.

Events.text: The United Kingdom establishes the Bechuanaland Protectorate.
Events.html: The United Kingdom establishes the Bechuanaland Protectorate.

links.title: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland

Events.text: The Eiffel Tower is officially opened.
Events.html: The Eiffel Tower is officially opened.

Events.text: Malolos, capital of the First Philippine Republic, is captured by American forces.
Events.html: Malolos, capital of the First Philippine Republic, is captured by American forces.

Events.text: The Intercollegiate Athletic Association of the United States (later the National Collegiate Athletic Association) is established to set rules for college sports in the United States.
Events.html: The Intercollegiate Athletic Association of the United States (later the National Collegiate Athletic Association) is established to set rules for college sports in the United States.

links.title: College sports in the United States

Events.text: Serbia accepts Austrian control over Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Events.html: Serbia accepts Austrian control over Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Events.text: The Vienna Concert Society rioted during a performance of modernist music by Arnold Schoenberg, Alban Berg, Alexander von Zemlinsky, and Anton von Webern, causing a premature end to the concert due to violence; this concert became known as the Skandalkonzert.
Events.html: The Vienna Concert Society rioted during a performance of modernist music by Arnold Schoenberg, Alban Berg, Alexander von Zemlinsky, and Anton von Webern, causing a premature end to the concert due to violence; this concert became known as the Skandalkonzert.

Events.text: The United States takes possession of the Danish West Indies after paying $25 million to Denmark, and renames the territory the United States Virgin Islands.
Events.html: The United States takes possession of the Danish West Indies after paying $25 million to Denmark, and renames the territory the United States Virgin Islands.

Events.text: Massacre of ethnic Azerbaijanis is committed by allied armed groups of Armenian Revolutionary Federation and Bolsheviks. Nearly 12,000 Azerbaijani Muslims are killed.
Events.html: Massacre of ethnic Azerbaijanis is committed by allied armed groups of Armenian Revolutionary Federation and Bolsheviks. Nearly 12,000 Azerbaijani Muslims are killed.

Events.text: Daylight saving time goes into effect in the United States for the first time.
Events.html: 1918 – Daylight saving time goes into effect in the United States for the first time.

Events.text: The Royal Australian Air Force is formed.
Events.html: The Royal Australian Air Force is formed.

Events.text: The Motion Picture Production Code is instituted, imposing strict guidelines on the treatment of sex, crime, religion and violence in film, in the U.S., for the next thirty-eight years.
Events.html: The Motion Picture Production Code is instituted, imposing strict guidelines on the treatment of sex, crime, religion and violence in film, in the U.S., for the next thirty-eight years.

Events.text: An earthquake in Nicaragua destroys Managua; killing 2,000.
Events.html: An earthquake in Nicaragua destroys Managua; killing 2,000.

Events.text: A Transcontinental & Western Air airliner crashes near Bazaar, Kansas, killing eight, including University of Notre Dame head football coach Knute Rockne.
Events.html: 1931 – A Transcontinental & Western Air airliner crashes near Bazaar, Kansas, killing eight, including University of Notre Dame head football coach Knute Rockne.

links.title: 1931 Transcontinental & Western Air Fokker F-10 crash

Events.text: The Civilian Conservation Corps is established with the mission of relieving rampant unemployment in the United States.
Events.html: The Civilian Conservation Corps is established with the mission of relieving rampant unemployment in the United States.

Events.text: World War II: Japanese forces invade Christmas Island, then a British possession.
Events.html: World War II: Japanese forces invade Christmas Island, then a British possession.

Events.text: World War II: A defecting German pilot delivers a Messerschmitt Me 262A-1, the world's first operational jet-powered fighter aircraft, to the Americans, the first to fall into Allied hands.
Events.html: World War II: A defecting German pilot delivers a Messerschmitt Me 262A-1, the world's first operational jet-powered fighter aircraft, to the Americans, the first to fall into Allied hands.

Events.text: The Dominion of Newfoundland joins the Canadian Confederation and becomes the 10th Province of Canada.
Events.html: The Dominion of Newfoundland joins the Canadian Confederation and becomes the 10th Province of Canada.

Events.text: Remington Rand delivers the first UNIVAC I computer to the United States Census Bureau.
Events.html: Remington Rand delivers the first UNIVAC I computer to the United States Census Bureau.

Events.text: Elections to the Territorial Assembly of the French colony Upper Volta are held. After the elections PDU and MDV form a government.
Events.html: Elections to the Territorial Assembly of the French colony Upper Volta are held. After the elections PDU and MDV form a government.

Events.text: In the Canadian federal election, the Progressive Conservatives, led by John Diefenbaker, win the largest percentage of seats in Canadian history, with 208 seats of 265.
Events.html: In the Canadian federal election, the Progressive Conservatives, led by John Diefenbaker, win the largest percentage of seats in Canadian history, with 208 seats of 265.

Events.text: The 14th Dalai Lama, crosses the border into India and is granted political asylum.
Events.html: The 14th Dalai Lama, crosses the border into India and is granted political asylum.

Events.text: A coup d'état in Brazil establishes a military government, under the aegis of general Castelo Branco.
Events.html: A coup d'état in Brazil establishes a military government, under the aegis of general Castelo Branco.

Events.text: The Soviet Union launches Luna 10 which later becomes the first space probe to enter orbit around the Moon.
Events.html: The Soviet Union launches Luna 10 which later becomes the first space probe to enter orbit around the Moon.

Events.text: Explorer 1 re-enters the Earth's atmosphere after 12 years in orbit.
Events.html: Explorer 1 re-enters the Earth's atmosphere after 12 years in orbit.

Events.text: The Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad operates its final train after being ordered to liquidate its assets because of bankruptcy and debts owed to creditors.
Events.html: The Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad operates its final train after being ordered to liquidate its assets because of bankruptcy and debts owed to creditors.

links.title: Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad

Events.text: The first WrestleMania, the biggest wrestling event from the WWE (then the WWF), takes place in Madison Square Garden in New York City.
Events.html: The first WrestleMania, the biggest wrestling event from the WWE (then the WWF), takes place in Madison Square Garden in New York City.

Events.text: Approximately 200,000 protesters take to the streets of London to protest against the newly introduced Poll Tax.
Events.html: Approximately 200,000 protesters take to the streets of London to protest against the newly introduced Poll Tax.

Events.text: Georgian independence referendum, 1991: Nearly 99 percent of the voters support the country's independence from the Soviet Union.
Events.html: Georgian independence referendum, 1991: Nearly 99 percent of the voters support the country's independence from the Soviet Union.

Events.text: The USS Missouri, the last active United States Navy battleship, is decommissioned in Long Beach, California.
Events.html: The USS Missouri, the last active United States Navy battleship, is decommissioned in Long Beach, California.

Events.text: Selena is murdered by her fan club's president Yolanda Saldivar at a Days Inn in Corpus Christi, Texas after accusations of Saldivar embezzling money from Selena's fan club.
Events.html: Selena is murdered by her fan club's president Yolanda Saldivar at a Days Inn in Corpus Christi, Texas after accusations of Saldivar embezzling money from Selena's fan club.

Events.text: Netscape releases Mozilla source code under an open source license.
Events.html: Netscape releases Mozilla source code under an open source license.

Events.text: Iraq War in Anbar Province: In Fallujah, Iraq, four American private military contractors working for Blackwater USA, are killed after being ambushed.
Events.html: Iraq War in Anbar Province: In Fallujah, Iraq, four American private military contractors working for Blackwater USA, are killed after being ambushed.
